Pre-Game Insights: India leads the three-match T20I series 2-0 against Sri Lanka and will look to complete a clean sweep in the final match.
Sri Lanka, on the other hand, will aim to salvage some pride and end the series on a high note, especially as they face India in a 3 Match ODI series starting early August.
Both teams have talented squads and will be eager to put on a strong performance.
Sri Lanka will be keen to avoid a whitewash and put up a strong performance in the final T20I.
India has shown dominance in the series with their all-round performances.
Led by Suryakumar Yadav, the team has been consistent with both bat and ball.
The pitch at Pallekele Cricket Stadium is expected to be balanced, offering assistance to both batsmen and bowlers.
Seamers might get some early movement, while spinners could become more effective as the game progresses.
Batsmen need to be cautious initially but can expect good scoring opportunities once set.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The weather in Kandy is expected to be showers in the morning, with a clear and sunny afternoon/evening.
There should be no interruptions in play, unlike the last match.
